title: Software Application Engineer Intern
targeted major: College of Engineering
description:
APPLY DIRECTLY ON COMPANY WEBSITE!
As a Software Application Engineer Intern, a typical day might include the following:
Supporting SEL software development and lifecycle process
Verifying that software meets requirements.
Support software product management, including technical support and content creation
Providing support to engineering staff as needed.
Following engineering quality assurance procedures.
Required Qualifications:
You are a current student pursuing a degree in engineering or equivalent with at least one year of technical coursework completed.
You have a desire to participate in technical marketing and sales activities
You are able to execute and document defined testing procedures.
You have strong writing, documentation, and speaking skills.
You are able to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities.
You are able to work cooperatively in a team environment.
Background check results satisfactory to SEL
Negative drug test result(s)
Preferred Qualifications:
General knowledge of the electric power system industry
General knowledge of product lifecycle management
Experience using scripting languages or programming languages, such as Python, Javascript, Perl, Ruby, C#, C++, Java.
Location Information
Pullman, WA - SEL corporate office is located in Eastern Washington where you'll enjoy an unmatched quality of life. Enjoy the smaller town life: country space, freedom from traffic, easy access to recreational activities in nearby mountains, rivers, and forests, as well as great schools and universities.
Pay Range Data
($19.50 - $32.50 per hour) * Our intern pay is determined based on the internship role (the work you would be doing) and your year in school (when you plan to graduate). Talk to your recruiter if you are curious about the rate for your year in school

title: Software Engineering, Software Architecture Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Robotics
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
This software engineering co-op will be focused on working with scripting tools surrounding Medtronic's new minimally invasive surgical robot, Hugo. Read this article to learn more about the system: https://www.massdevice.com/medtronic-finally-unveils-its-new-robot-assisted-surgery-system/
Specific Job Functions:
-Contribute to development and testing of existing scripts
-Prototype concepts to improve automation workflow
-Automate existing workflows to enhance the development process
-Generate ideas for the next project in the Software Architecture spaceRequired Experience:
-Familiarity with Python and other scripting languages
-Experience with Software Development and Design Principles
-Git or comparable version control experience
-Basic knowledge of UML/SysMLPreferred Experience:
-Experience with Web Development
-Experience with automated Documentation and Templating tools
-Experience with Unit Testing and Python Debugging
-Previous experience working with Agile software development tools like Bitbucket, Jira, and Confluence.

title: Civil Engineering Co-Op - Summer 2026
location:
Newark, NJ, USA
Houston, TX, USA

Bethlehem, PA, USA
Lake Como, NJ, USA
Audubon, PA, USA
Philadelphia, PA, USA
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Environmental Engineering
College of Engineering/Civil Engineering
description:
The Dynamic Internship allows current undergraduate students, graduate students, and/or recent graduates the opportunity to develop engineering experience in either Land Development, Environmental/Geotechnical, Traffic/Transportation, or Land Survey.

Position Summaries:

Land Development Internship
The Design Intern is responsible for the due diligence investigations as well as preliminary design and engineering analyses of various types of retail, commercial, industrial and residential site layouts throughout regions where we do business. Projects include working with several Fortune 500 companies, as well as working with local and regional developers with varying degrees of complexity.
Responsibilities:
Review municipal zoning and land development ordinances and applicable agency regulations to determine land development limitations for the property.
Prepare Site Investigation and Due Diligence Reports to include the review of ordinances, utility service research, outside agency regulations and site visits to establish comprehensive development guidelines.
Prepare Conceptual Site Plans.
Prepare preliminary Grading Plans and Design.
Design of Stormwater Management and Stormwater Conveyance Systems, Utility Systems and Soil Erosion and Sediment Control Design Plans.
Prepare technical reports including drainage, sanitary sewer and site investigation reports.
Prepare written correspondence to outside agencies, client, attorney, contractor, etc.
Perform other tasks as assigned

Geotechnical/Environmental Internship
The Geotechnical Intern is responsible for various field, laboratory and engineering tasks needed to support the geotechnical group throughout regions where we do business.  Intern responsibilities typically include training to complete on site construction phase soil and concrete testing and inspection; conducting soil laboratory tests, and preparing inspection and data reports.  Projects typically include working with several Fortune 500 companies, as well as working with local and regional developers with varying degrees of complexity.  
Responsibilities:
Conduct construction site testing, inspection and sampling
Perform concrete placement tests including slump, air content, temperature, monitoring material compliance with project specifications, and concrete cylinder fabrication.  Services also include sample transport to laboratory when applicable.
Perform soil compaction testing and fill placement monitoring.
Conduct laboratory soils testing for permeability, maximum dry density/optimum moisture content determination.
Witness and document soil borings and/or test pit investigations as part of a site geotechnical investigation.
Prepare inspection reports, laboratory data reports and other project correspondence.
Deliver samples and/or testing equipment between sites, office and laboratory as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Traffic Internship
The Traffic Intern works alongside the Design Engineer and under the direction of a Project Manager and is responsible for day-to-day project work producing technical deliverables for traffic and transportation engineering projects. 
Responsibilities:
Establish and monitor adherence to project schedule and budget.
Provide all necessary coordination and follow-up on the work to ensure quality standards are met, efficiency levels are maintained and client satisfaction, respect and confidence are assured.
Assist in the development of traffic control device design plans, including traffic signal, signing, pavement marking, lighting and ITS plans.
Create clear, concise technical reports and high quality drawings, primarily using AutoCAD.
Perform field duties outside of the office in support of projects, including traffic data collection and field verifications of existing and proposed traffic control device installations.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Survey Internship
The Survey Intern is primarily responsible for assisting in land surveying duties. Responsibilities include a variety of technical duties in the areas of surveying, construction, operations, and maintenance in support of surveyors, staff engineers and supervisors. The Survey Intern will assist with obtaining necessary data to complete surveys on behalf of the company. 
Responsibilities:
Perform selected survey assignments, quickly and accurately.
Perform a variety of surveys including site surveys, boundary, topographic, plot plans, roadway utility and subdivision plans.
Preparation and set-up of survey files for field crews.
Prepare field notes and organize field equipment.
Conduct grade sheet computations.
Deed and Filed Map Research for Boundary Analysis
Topographic/As-built Surveys and/or Boundary Survey Sketches.
Preparation of Metes & Bounds Descriptions.
Project Datum Conversion/Transformation.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Internship Qualifications
Pursuing or in receipt of a Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering.
0-2 years’ experience in Civil Site Engineering (residential and/or commercial/industrial/office site design and permitting experience).
Engineer-In-Training (EIT) preferred.
Valid driver’s license.
Ability to maintain and operate personal and/or company vehicle.

Internship Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Familiar with the use of AutoCAD to assist in the production of site plan drawings.
Knowledge of Hydraulic and Stormwater Design Programs.
Design and drafting capabilities.
Grading and drainage design skills.
Proficient in the use of available mapping websites for due diligence and site investigation purposes.
Proficient in the use of the following design tools for site engineering:
Hydraflow-Hydrographs
Flow-Comp
HydraCAD
Hydraflow – Storm Sewers
Various Nomographs
Gravity Flow – Hydraulic Analysis, Manning’s Equation
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Software including Word, Excel, Outlook and Project.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Independent and critical thinking abilities.
Self-starter who can work independently and with team members.

Internship Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Gravity Flow – Hydraulic Analysis, Manning’s Equation

title: Software Engineering
targeted major:
College of Engineering
College of Engineering/Telecommunication Networks
College of Engineering/Robotics
College of Engineering/Operations Research
College of Engineering/Information Systems
College of Engineering/Electrical Engineering
College of Engineering/Electrical and Computer Engineering
College of Engineering/Computer System Engineering
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
College of Engineering/Internet of Things
College of Engineering/Software Engineering Systems
College of Engineering/Cyber Physical Systems
description:
Job Requisition IDJR2003206Job CategoryUniv Employment
By submitting your resume, you’re expressing interest in one of our 2026 Software Engineering Internships. We’ll review resumes on an ongoing basis, and a recruiter may reach out if your experience fits one of our many internship opportunities. 
  NVIDIA pioneered accelerated computing to tackle challenges no one else can solve. Our work in AI and digital twins is transforming the world's largest industries and profoundly impacting society — from gaming to robotics, self-driving cars to life-saving healthcare, climate change to virtual worlds where we can all connect and create. 
  Our internships offer an excellent opportunity to expand your career and get hands on experience with one of our industry leading Software teams. We’re seeking strategic, ambitious, hard-working, and creative individuals who are passionate about helping us tackle challenges no one else can solve. 
  Throughout the 12-week minimum full-time internship, students will work on projects that have a measurable impact on our business. We’re looking for students pursuing Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree within a relevant or related field.  
  Potential Internships in this field include:  
Development Tools 
Debugging complex system-level issues using Jenkins  
Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Relational Databases, Linear Algebra & Numerical Methods, Operating Systems (memory/resource management), Scheduling and Process Control, Hardware Virtualization 
Cloud 
Supporting overall architecture and design of our cloud storage infrastructure  
Implementing and troubleshooting storage and data platform tools, automating storage infrastructure end-to-end 
Course or internship experience related to the following areas could be required: Distributed Systems, Data Structures & Algorithms, Virtualization, Automation/Scripting, Container & Cluster Management, Debugging 
Tools Infrastructure 
Building industry leading technology by proving workflows and infrastructure, alongside a team of experts in production software development and chip design methodologies 
Enabling success for content running on the chip from application tracing and analysis to modeling, diagnostics, performance tuning, and debugging  
Course or internship experience related to the following areas and technologies could be required: Unix/Shell Scripting, Linux, Java, JavaScript (including Node, React, Vue), C++, CUDA, OOP, Go, Python, Git, GitLab, Perforce, Kubernetes and Microservices, Schedulers (LSF, SLURM), Containers (Docker), Configuration Automation (Ansible) 
Machine Learning Operations 
Deep Learning, GPU Computing, Accelerated Computing 
Validation Frameworks for Deep Learning, Deep Learning Frameworks and Libraries (NumPy, SciPy, cuBLAS, cuDNN) 
Data Preprocessing, Training Acceleration (CUDA, cuDNN, NCCL), Convolution Operations (cuDNN), Real-Time Inference (TensorRT)   
Building Infrastructure for Back-End Analytics  
What we need to see:  
Must be actively enrolled in a university pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field, for the entire duration of the internship.        
Depending on the internship role, prior experience or knowledge requirements could include the following programming skills and technologies:
Java, JavaScript, (including Node, React, Vue), SQL, C, C++, CUDA, OOP, Go, Python, Git, Perforce, Kubernetes and Microservices, Schedulers (LSF, SLURM), Containers (Docker), Configuration Automation (Ansible)  
  Click here to learn more about NVIDIA, our early talent programs, benefits offered to students and other helpful student resources related to our latest technologies and endeavors. 
Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay based on the position, your location, year in school, degree, and experience. The hourly rate for our interns is 20 USD - 71 USD.
You will also be eligible for Intern benefits. 
Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis. NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Software Engineering Co-op - Engineering Tools
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Electrical Engineering
College of Engineering/Electrical and Computer Engineering
description:
You know the moment. It’s the first notes of that song you love, the intro to your favorite movie, or simply the sound of someone you love saying “hello.” It’s in these moments that sound matters most. 
At Bose, we believe sound is the most powerful force on earth. We’ve dedicated ourselves to improving it for more than 60 years. And we’re passionate down to our bones about making whatever you’re listening to a little more magical.  
The Engineering team at Bose is a thriving, passionate, deeply skilled team of professionals from a broad range of disciplines and experiences, who share a common goal—to create products that provide transformative sound experiences.
Job Description
THE PROGRAM
We're looking for students to join our Co-Op Program who believe that sound is power. Over the 6-month co-op, you will get the opportunity to apply the skills you learned in the classroom with hands-on work experience. Our Co-Ops will get to network across the business to understand different perspectives at Bose. You'll connect with other Co-Ops and colleagues to grow your network for the future!
Timeframe - Spring Co-op- Must be available January 12- June 26, 2026 and able to work in a hybrid work environment
THE ROLE
The tool infrastructure engineering team is looking for a software engineering co-op with a strong interest in working on audio architecture and systems. The engineer will be working on aspects of Bose consumer and Automotive sound systems for rapid prototyping purposes. The engineering co-op will be working on an audio tuning tool related to an electrical engineering project. You will work together with electrical, software, mechanical and system A/D engineers in a close-knit team. The hardware infrastructure tool team requires a hands-on personality.
The co-op will focus on the development equipment that is used to perform acoustic research which are referred to as ‘tools’. You will work on the design of microcontroller firmware targeted for these tools, be exposed to architecture development, and you may develop network interface support software for Ethernet interface or Analog Devices A2B networks.
REQUIREMENTS
To be successful in this role, you should be/have:
Your skill set should include:
- Pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent, MS degree preferred
-             Software development in C and preferably Python
-             Object-oriented software design and programming skills using C/C++
-             Good communication skills
-             Decent mathematical modeling skills and intuition
Nice to haves:
-             Some understanding of and/or experience with embedded processors
-             Linux operating systems and/or embedded Linux and kernel driver frameworks
-             Source code management (Git and GitHub)
-             Can read and understand electronic schematics
-             Experience with basic lab equipment (oscilloscopes, power supplies, multi-meters, etc.)
-             Ability to manage workload across multiple projects with varying priorities
-             Creative and inquisitive approach to problem solving
-             Curious mindset not afraid to try new things
-             Natural interest and experience working on cars and audio systems
Bose is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. The EEOC’s “Know Your Rights: Workplace discrimination is illegal” Poster is available here: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf. Bose is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to applicant_disability_accommodationrequest@bose.com. Please include "Application Accommodation Request" in the subject of the email.
Our goal is to create an atmosphere where every candidate feels supported and empowered in the interviewing process. Diversity and inclusion are integral to our success, and we believe that providing reasonable accommodation is not only a legal obligation but also a fundamental aspect of our commitment to being an employer of choice. We recognize that individuals may have different needs and requirements based on their abilities, and we provide reasonable accommodations to ensure ideal conditions are met during the application process.

title: Software Engineering Intern
targeted major:
College of Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences
description:
Title: Intern, Software Engineer
The Department: Software Engineering
Gemini is regulated and licensed like a bank, but it’s run like a tech startup, and engineering is the core of the company.  There’s a wide range of tough problems to solve at Gemini – from properly securing hundreds of millions of dollars worth of customer funds, to developing innovative new blockchain products, to finding new techniques to combat fraud, to shaving microseconds off our API response times, and everything in between.
All of Gemini’s engineers are able to work across the software platform, not just on their own specialization or subteam. We value a thoughtful, collaborative software development process, coupled with a pragmatic approach to problem solving and delivering software.
The Role: Software Engineer Intern
As a member of our software engineering team, you’ll architect and solve complex problems that will directly influence the direction of the digital asset space. There’s a wide range of problems to solve at Gemini – from properly securing millions of dollars worth of customer funds, to developing innovative new blockchain products, to shaving microseconds off our API response times. We have a strong culture of code reviews, and a focus on security, with the end goal of writing and shipping high-quality code by getting things right the first time. We want to continue building the best product we can as we scale and grow our business. If you get excited about solving technical challenges that directly impact our customers, clients, and the rest of the Gemini team, we’d love to hear from you. There are opportunities for frontend and/or backend work depending on your interests and strengths.
Responsibilities: 
Drive the development of new products and features on the Gemini platform, taking ownership of meaningful projects within small, fast-moving teams.
Collaborate closely with senior engineers who will challenge you to raise the bar on design, testing, and scalability while providing mentorship and guidance.
Contribute technical ideas and solutions during planning and design discussions, influencing the direction of key initiatives.
Review and critique code with a focus on correctness, performance, and security—while learning best practices from experienced engineers.
Enhance the reliability, performance, and maintainability of Gemini’s systems through thoughtful refactoring and continuous improvement projects.
Take part in supporting production systems by helping diagnose and resolve alerts or bugs, gaining hands-on experience with real-world operations at scale.
Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field (Bachelor’s, Associate’s, or Master’s).
Passionate about blockchain, digital assets, and the Web3 industry—a genuine drive to make an impact in this space is essential.
Solid understanding of core software engineering and coding concepts, with curiosity to go deeper and learn quickly.
Self-motivated and proactive—you take initiative, ask smart questions, and push projects forward without waiting to be told what to do.
Strong communication skills: able to clearly articulate ideas, provide updates, and collaborate effectively in a team setting.
Open to feedback and committed to growth—willing to challenge yourself, learn from experience, and raise the bar with every project.

title: Software Engineering Intern
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Information Systems
College of Engineering/Computer System Engineering
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
College of Engineering/Software Engineering Systems
Khoury College of Computer Sciences
description:
S1 Industries PBC, Incorporated is a small, for-profit public benefit company that aims to make technologies accessible to people who are seeking to solve problems that matter. We follow a proven technology innovation method developed over two decades at MIT by S1 Industries PBC’s founder Luis P. Breva, PhD. At MIT alone, this method has moved 200+ technologies to impact and yielded 40+ new, enduring organizations. At S1 Industries PBC, we apply this method in industry and address the question: what if we could use technology to reestablish the connection between an individual’s work and their economic progress?
We are seeking Software Engineering Interns who will be key team members that contribute directly to our core products and services. We are particularly looking for individuals who are curious and excited to engage with a broad range of topics in engineering, science, and technology. Candidates need not be pursing an Engineering or Science degree for this position.
Primary Responsibilities:
Work with engineers, researchers, scientists, and other professionals
Develop and propose new software and/or hardware products
Contribute to developing creative uses for technologies
Support Engineering production including QA and testing
Summarize and present information in a professional manner
Education/Experience:
Candidate for a bachelor’s or master’s degree
Experience with one or more of the following is preferred but not required:
Creating something tangible that works
Programming - especially with Swift and visionOS
Computer vision
Human visual perception in virtual and/or augmented reality environments
Database development and application-database integration
Production environments
Skills and Abilities:
Successful candidates will demonstrate curiosity, intellectual courage, and a desire to learn. Each candidate will be expected to apply their knowledge, ingenuity, and entrepreneurial mindset to make things that solve problems for people. We ask you to use your experience creating things, be they physical creations, software programming, or something else, to make tangible solutions to problems using technology.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Arc Impact Acquisition Corporation
Owner of the Desktop Metal ® brand and products
Software Engineering Co-op
Arc is revolutionizing 3D printing of metal parts. We're reshaping the future of manufacturing through innovative additive manufacturing technologies. We believe that resilience, curiosity, and collaboration are key to navigating growth and change. That's why we're seeking talented and self-motivated co-ops who are excited to tackle meaningful work, contribute fresh perspectives, and help transform an industry.
At Arc, a software engineering co-op will have the opportunity to work across a variety of software and computer engineering disciplines, from low-level firmware and embedded device software to 3D geometry and modeling application software.
  Responsibilities:
Designing and implementing software solutions for 3D
Writing and developing specifications, design verification plans, and functional test
Working with an interdisciplinary team of material scientists, product managers, and process, mechanical and electrical engineers to find elegant solutions to complex problems.
  Basic Qualifications:
Understanding of technical principles of software development and computer
Experience with object-oriented programming in Python and C++.
Interest in computational geometry, robotics or additive
Excellent written and oral communication
Knowledge of signal handling in multi-threaded
Familiarity with source control, code reviews, and bug tracking
  Preferred Experiences:
3D
Qt and Qt
Automated build and test and/or test-driven
Microcontrollers, microprocessors, and mixed-signal
Motion controller setup and
Experience with 3D graphics or computational
Understanding of networking protocols and

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Robotics
College of Engineering/Electrical and Computer Engineering
College of Engineering/Product Development
College of Engineering/Software Engineering Systems
description:
Ready to dive into real-world challenges? As a Software Engineering Co-op, you'll be embedded in dynamic projects across diverse industries like cutting-edge medical devices, innovative consumer products, advanced industrial automation, and critical defense systems. This isn't about isolated tasks; you'll join interdisciplinary teams tackling complex problems from concept to implementation, shaping solutions that truly make a difference. We're looking for driven individuals with a hunger to learn, a sharp focus on the bigger picture – understanding how your work contributes to entire systems and the world beyond – and the ability to innovate independently and collaboratively. Expect to apply your software engineering skills in a fast-paced environment where your creativity and problem-solving abilities will be essential to delivering impactful results.
Co-ops who thrive in this role are creative problem solvers who enjoy a dynamic and engaging work environment. 
Learn more about Boston Engineering! 
What we’re looking for:
A solid grasp of the software engineering major courses: Programming methods, algorithms, high-level languages, and computer system architecture
Experience with high-level software architecture and object-oriented programming.
Comfortable with git
Intermediate experience with one of the following programming languages, preferably through personal projects, previous work experience, or coursework: C, C++, Python
Confident with hands-on analog, digital, power, and software components
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
  Interest or experience with the following:
Ability to read and understand schematics
Hands-on experience with the use of power supplies, oscilloscopes, and other essential laboratory equipment for testing and debugging
Hands-on experience developing code (C, C++) for embedded platforms
Hardware interfacing with microcontrollers and/or digital systems, including experience with programming/debugging environments and tools.
Experience with ROS2 and Linux
Interest in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in a hands-on and/or classroom setting
Experience with full-stack development
This role is restricted to US citizens due to access to export-controlled technology. Boston Engineering will require proof of citizenship.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Software Engineering Systems
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
TMC is the world leader in precision floor vibration isolation technology serving major research centers, OEM and end-user semiconductor manufacturers, university research laboratories, drug discovery companies, and nanotechnology labs (http://www.techmfg.com/). We are a unit of AMETEK, Inc., a leading global manufacturer of electronic instruments and electro-mechanical devices with annualized sales exceeding $8 billion (https://www.ametek.com/).
TMC - AMETEK is seeking a highly motivated Software Engineering student to join our New Product Development team. This internship/co-op opportunity offers hands-on experience in designing, coding, testing, and deploying software that powers our advanced vibration cancellation systems. You’ll work alongside experienced engineers, gain exposure to real-world applications, and contribute to meaningful projects that support precision technologies used in cutting-edge industries.
  If you are interested in a challenging assignment working alongside industry leaders and possess the necessary talent and skills, we'll be looking forward to hearing from you!
Specific Duties and Responsibilities
Develop monitoring and diagnostic software used to check health status, monitor performance, and optimize tuning of TMC active vibration control systems.
Participate in code reviews, debugging, and performance optimization.
Support existing Graphical User Interface programs and/or create/modify them to communicate with a TMC system controller using serial link and serial commands.
Explore new technologies and contribute to prototype development.
Support debugging and performance optimization efforts.
Collaborate with engineers to integrate and test software solutions.
Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a technical degree, preferably in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related Engineering discipline.
Strong interest in software development and real-world engineering applications.
Eager to take on challenging assignments and collaborate with experienced professionals.
Coursework or hands-on experience in C/C++, Python, and C#.
Familiarity with GUI development using WinForms, WPF, or QT.
Basic understanding of web technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a willingness to learn.
Effective communication and teamwork abilities.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major: College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
description:
WHY WE NEED YOU
Hydrow is looking for a Software Engineering Co-op to help our growing membership be healthier and happier.
This position is open to Northeastern University students only.
You will be developing full features and shipping actual products to customers. This is an opportunity to get to work embedded with an experienced engineering team. This is a real day to day being part of the core team.
Depending on your strengths, interests and engineering roadmap, you may contribute to existing projects building customer-facing web interfaces, contributing to core feature development on our Android-based hardware, developing our mobile applications on iOS or Android, contributing to our Cloud APIs or otherwise working within our software ecosystem
WHAT YOU’LL ACCOMPLISH
You will work closely with Hydrow software engineers to design, develop, and test software projects.
You will join our team and participate in all Engineering meetings and activities.
Depending on the team you work with you with do one or more of the following:
You will write full-stack software with Typescript and React
You will write applications for Android based hardware in Kotlin
You will write mobile applications for iOS in Swift, or Android in Kotlin
WHO YOU ARE
Intelligence - Learns quickly and demonstrates ability to quickly and proficiently understand, absorb, and synthesize new information. You have an understanding, or an interest in, the foundations of computer science theory including data structures, algorithms, and software design. You are proficient in an object-oriented programming language such as Swift, Kotlin, Python, Java, Node.js, C++, Go, or Javascript. You have strong communication skills and know when to ask questions
Enthusiasm - Exhibits passion and excitement over work. Has a can-do attitude. You have a strong, insatiable desire to learn and hone your craft. You are detail oriented and aren’t afraid to go really deep on an issue
Growth Mindset - You enjoy the process of getting better at what you do, and you seek out the feedback that improves your ability to learn from your experiences. You have some experience writing software, either a web application or native applications.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Software Engineering Co-op
This is a full time 6-month Co-op starting in January 2026 and ending in June 2026.
   INVENT. IMPROVE. INSPIRE.
Fresenius Medical is not your typical medical products company. We are a close-knit team of talented professionals driven by a shared commitment: to lead a movement to dramatically improve renal care with innovative yet simple therapeutic solutions that benefit patients, caregivers, and society. We pursue this goal through a passionate commitment to Innovate, Educate and Advocate for the breakthroughs that are redefining renal care. Additionally, Fresenius works in community with its customers, patients, industry partners, and government leaders and agencies to realize the vision of better, simpler, more accessible renal care.
  Position Summary:
Participate in the design, development, and testing of Fresenius Medical’s software products and/or related tools.
  Core Responsibilities:
·        Assignment will vary but may include embedded SW development, Windows, Linux tools and/or scripting projects.
·        Add new functionality, as needed, along with supporting documentation and unit tests.
·        Ensure all activities conform to design controls. Ensure all analysis, design, and testing activities are properly documented.
·        Debugging new designs and developing reliability improvements to existing & new designs.
·        Perform other duties as assigned.
  Requirements:
Software:
·        Candidate for BS in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering
·        Programming in Java, C/C++; Objective C, C#/.net preferred; asp.net a plus
·        Embedded programming experience preferred
·        Java, JavaScript
·        Technical knowledge in software development methodologies, design, and implementation
·        Beginning analytical and design skills
·        Basic knowledge of project lifecycles, software development environments, and source control techniques

title: Software Engineering Co-Op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Computer System Engineering
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Bevi is seeking a Software Engineering Co-Op. As a Software Co-op, you’ll work on web application projects written in Typescript with day-to-day help from Bevi's engineering team. It’s very likely the projects you work on will be deployed to production and used by thousands of users every day. We are a small and fun software team in a fast-growing hardware startup. Our customers love our product and you will play a crucial role in making them even happier. If you love thinking through new ideas and interactions, how to execute them in an innovative way, and have a deep respect for user experience, come join our team! 
Location - This role is based out of our Charlestown office, at least 2 days per week in person (more if desired!) 
What You’ll Do:
Dive deep into our technology stack, working with a modern toolkit that includes TypeScript, React, and Apollo GraphQL. You'll be building and shipping new features from front to back, giving you a comprehensive understanding of what it takes to build and maintain a scalable web application. 
Shape the interactions of thousands of active users. You will contribute directly to our core web applications, crafting seamless and delightful user experiences. ● Be part of our commitment to code excellence. We believe in building robust, reliable software, so you’ll spend time writing unit and integration tests to validate the features that you have built. 
Step into the role of a peer and a mentor by actively participating in our code review process. You’ll learn to give and receive constructive feedback that will sharpen your skills. 
Diagnose and resolve live bugs and production issues that are reported in the field. You will learn how to quickly triage, debug, and deploy fixes to prevent customer pain and ensure a smooth user experience. 
Work side-by-side with our experienced engineers, designers, and product managers. This is a chance to see how a high-performing, cross-functional team operates, giving you invaluable insights into the entire software development lifecycle—from ideation to deployment. You’ll gain exposure to different roles and participate as an active member in sprint planning and design discussions. 
How you will grow:
Engage with a talented software and hardware engineering team drawn from diverse sectors and learn how best-in-class teams work using industry standard tools. ● Gain experience in the software engineering IoT and Robotics disciplines ● Work at the heart of a start-up in high-growth mode 
Deploy your energy and expertise to further the company's mission of sustainability, wellness, and positive personal and environmental change 
What We’re Looking For:
Currently enrolled in a University with a major or minor in Computer Science or Software Engineering program, or related field. 
Proficiency in Typescript or Javascript. 
Strong proficiency with React or other UI frameworks. 
Knowledge of CSS fundamentals. Experience with component libraries is a plus. ● Experience working with and making web API calls; knowledge of GraphQL is a plus. ● Familiarity with Git or similar version control systems. 
An understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design with an ability to debug code and write unit tests. 
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. 
Good verbal and written communication skills. 
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills. 
Genuine desire and commitment to always learn, improve, and produce the best work possible.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Contract: Full-time, Co-op (6-month term) 
Location: Waltham, MA 
Qualification: Currently pursuing a BS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field 
Minimum experience: Coursework in C/C++, object-oriented design, machine learning, and hands-on lab or project experience 
Job Summary: 
CellTivity Scientific is seeking a motivated Software Engineering Co-op to support our engineering and production teams. This position offers hands-on experience in C/C++, C#/.NET, Python, ML, Computer Vision, hardware development and assembly in a regulated medical device environment. The Co-op will work closely with engineers and technicians to gain exposure to product development, manufacturing processes, quality systems, and medical device regulations. 
  Principal Duties and Responsibilities: 
Software Development: 
Assist with development and bug fixes of medical device software. 
Work on independent machine learning projects related to computer vision, image processing, and cellular analysis. 
Contribute to refactoring of older codebase into modern pipelines. 
Hands-On Engineering: 
Participate in building and testing prototypes and assemblies. 
Assist with troubleshooting production issues and performing simple root-cause analysis. 
Help develop and refine assembly procedures and work instructions. 
Process Development: 
Assist with documenting and standardizing software practices.
Support creation and refinement of necessary documentation for regulatory standards (ISO 13485, IEC 62304, CE Mark). 
Learn key regulatory practices for medical device development. 
Collaboration: 
Work under the guidance of engineers and cross-functional team members in Agile environment. 
Collaborate with technicians and operators to support day-to-day production activities. 
Present project updates and findings to the engineering team. 
Qualifications: 
Currently enrolled in a Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related undergraduate program. 
Completed coursework in C/C++, object-oriented design, and machine learning 
Proficiency in Object Oriented Design, Machine Learning principles, and independent project development (coursework or project-based). 
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. 
Willingness to be hands-on with builds, testing, and assembly. 
Preferred Skills: 
Familiarity and experience with C/C++ and C#/.NET. 
Experience with hardware (Cameras, FPGAs, Frame grabbers, Robotics). 
Experience with agile software teams
Exposure to regulated industries (medical devices, aerospace, etc.). 
Strong teamwork and communication skills. 
Company Description: 
At CellTivity Scientific (Waltham, MA), our mission is to become the standard of care for tissue adequacy assessment. Tissue and biopsy assessment is critical for the proceduralists performing the biopsies, for the patients who need immediate information, and for Next Generation Sequencing that requires enough live cancer cells. 
What Makes CellTivity Scientific Different? We combine two unique and proprietary technologies in one exam, offering a non-invasive, non-destructive, intra-procedural tissue adequacy assessment, in freshly excised tissue, within 2 minutes. Our technologies capture unique data on architecture at high resolution (1 µm in 3D) and microscopic intracellular activity and behaviors in freshly excised tissue, without staining or destroying the tissue. 
  CellTivity Scientific is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. 
  Pay Range: $26-35/hr.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major: College of Engineering/Software Engineering Systems
description:
We're looking for talented Software Engineering Interns to join one of our fully distributed Product Engineering teams.

Our tech:
Modern stack applications (React, TypeScript, Ruby on Rails, GraphQL & REST API) deployed to AWS and GCP.
Postgres / AWS RDS, Redis, S3.
Highly automated CI/CD pipeline.
Docker, Kubernetes, AWS EKS, ECS.
If you have exposure to any of these technologies, great! If not, consider this an opportunity to learn more about them.

What you'll do as a Software Engineering Intern:
Work with our web apps with React framework, and backend with Ruby on Rails, Postgres through AWS RDS, and GraphQL
Collaborate with designers, developers across the stack, QA engineers, and product managers on a cross-functional team
Learn the stack through maintenance, fixing low to medium complexity bugs
Progress to work on product enhancements; be involved in all phases of development, from ideation to release to tracking and analyzing the impact of shipped features
Thoroughly test your own code, from unit tests to automated end-to-end tests
Ship code continuously
Participate in daily stand-ups, software design sessions, code reviews, and sprint retrospectives

What we're looking for:
Previous co-op experience as a software engineer building web applications
Thoughtful, collaborative communication skills
An action-oriented approach to getting things done and a love of problem solving
A willingness to learn in any part of the stack - from web interfaces to APIs, data layers and back-end services
The ability to work autonomously, yet ask for help if getting stuck

title: Software Engineering Co-Op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
MUST APPLY IN NUWORKS AND COMOANY WESBITE USING THE FOLLOWING LINK:
https://www.careersatfm.com/job/johnston/software-engineering-co-op/474/85700626608
Responsibilities
Established nearly two centuries ago, FM is a leading mutual insurance company whose capital, scientific research capability and engineering expertise are solely dedicated to property risk management and the resilience of its policyholder-owners. These owners, who share the belief that the majority of property loss is preventable, represent many of the world’s largest organizations, including one of every four Fortune 500 companies. They work with FM to better understand the hazards that can impact their business continuity to make cost-effective risk management decisions, combining property loss prevention with insurance protection.
This US-based remote opportunity may require periodic travel to our corporate headquarters in Johnston, RI, which is part of the greater Providence area. 
With a large college-age population, Providence offers a vibrant arts and entertainment scene that includes local theatre and music, collegiate and minor league sporting events, and excellent restaurants, and we’re not that far from the breathtaking RI beaches! 
Schedule
Must be able to work full time 37.5 hours a week for January- June 2026.  
Hours: 9am to 5pm EST Monday- Friday 
FM is hiring a Software Engineering Co-Op to join our team for the Spring 2026 School Term, Full-time for 6 months.
This is an excellent opportunity for motivated students to apply their classroom experience, professional attitude, and personal ambition. You will get firsthand experience while earning college credits and getting paid! 
As a software development co-op, you will have the opportunity to work on real-world problems and solutions with a team of talented developers. Your projects may consist of developing or modifying business applications, integrating business applications and databases, augmenting rapid software delivery and deployment processes, and automating software testing.
Education
Must be enrolled as a full-time student studying Computer Science, or related degree program degree during the Spring 2026 Semester to be considered.   
Technical Skills
Knowledge of Theory and principles of software engineering  
Proficiency in high-level programming languages:
Objected Oriented Programming: C# or Java
SQL or Oracle
Typescript, REACT, Angular or JavaScript        
Personal projects with technical skills listed and Student involvement on campus a plus!
Soft Skills
Ability to work effectively in teams and solve problems  
Desire and willingness to learn new technologies 
The hiring range for this position is $24.00 to $33.00 per hour. The final salary offer will vary based on geographic location, individual education, skills, and experience.
FM is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining a diverse workforce.

title: Software Engineering Co-op
targeted major:
College of Engineering/Electrical Engineering
College of Engineering/Electrical and Computer Engineering
College of Engineering/Computer Engineering
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Data Science
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Cybersecurity
Khoury College of Computer Sciences/Computer Science
description:
Please apply directly through the Careers at Apple site:
https://jobs.apple.com/en-us/details/200606145-3810/software-engineering-internships?team=STDNT
Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple is seeking highly motivated, engineering students with a strong background in either Back-End Engineering, Core OS, Web Development, and iOS and/or macOS app Development to join its team of highly skilled software engineers.
At Apple, our software engineers are the brains behind some of the industry’s biggest breakthroughs! macOS, Siri, Apple Maps, iOS and iCloud — not to mention the system-level software for iPhone and Apple TV — all started here. These teams are on the front line of our constant charge toward innovation.
Description
Some responsibilities in Software Engineering may include:
Backend Development – Building the features that Apple users love (like Siri) work by presenting data to the user-facing applications. Backend development opportunities are available for students in the following areas: Siri, iCloud, Apple Maps, Core OS, macOS, Frameworks and Applications, Audio and Media Technologies, Graphics and Displays, Audio/Video Software Integration and Localization, Advanced Computation, iWorks, Pro Apps, Apple Music, Security, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE).
Core OS - The Core OS team is responsible for the design, build, and development of core technologies that are deployed across all Apple. Product areas include the iPhone, iPad, Watch, MacBook, iMac, Apple TV, Vision Pro and audio accessories.
User Experience (UX) – works closely with the other designers on the team. They are responsible for building elegant UX experiences that are simple, intuitive, and impactful. They are working in a constantly evolving environment and perform effectively under dynamic fast-paced conditions.
User Interface (UI) - You will work with UX team, backend engineers and other front end engineers to develop a web portal for building an end to end software development journey.
iOS and Web Development - Helps build web-based and iOS tools and applications to improve our products and do more for our customers. Our developers are responsible for crafting the direction of our products by considering the architecture, performance, testing, design, and implementation.
Information Systems & Technology (IS&T) - Produce key business and technical infrastructure at Apple handling orders from the online store, building applications that improve the retail store experience, developing solutions to enable customers to learn about and support their devices, providing network bandwidth for our services around the world, processing every transaction in iTunes, and closing the books. From Apple ID to the Apple website to our data centers around the globe, IS&T manages the systems and services that so many rely on. They also build the custom tools that empower our employees to solve problems on their own.
Information Security - protects Apple's information, including business, employee, and customer data wherever it goes. Our tools and services protect against threats that seek to compromise our systems, monitor the stability and security of our internal environment, and track emerging threats and vulnerabilities that might build an opportunity for an attacker.
Engineers at Apple work on both UI level and lower-level implementation details. The successful intern candidate will be amenable to working in an exciting, fast paced, dynamic, collaborative environment. The person filling this position must be a hands-on, enthusiastic, self-motivated developer with strong initiative. You will have a real passion for extraordinary user experiences and an eye for details.
Minimum Qualifications
Pursuing BS/MS/PhD program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Data Science, Design, or related fields.
At the end of the internship, you must return to school to continue your education or the internship must be the last requirement for you to graduate.
Preferred Qualifications
It’s helpful if you meet one or more of the following qualifications, but it isn’t a requirement
Strong object-oriented design skills, coupled with a deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Proficiency in one or more developer skills: Java, C/C++, PHP, Python, Ruby, Unix, MySQL, Clojure, Scala, Java Script, CSS, HTML5, Swift
Experience in sophisticated methodologies such as Data Modeling, Validation, Processing, MapReduce
Experience with distributed technologies such as HDFS, Spark, Golang, Hadoop, Mongo, Pig, Hive
Experience with web frameworks such as AngularJS, NodeJS, SproutCore
Experience with iOS and macOS developing in Swift, XCode or Objective-C
Client-Server protocol & API design Skills
Able to craft multi-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks
A fundamental knowledge of embedded processors, with in-depth knowledge of real time operating system concepts
Excellent debugging and critical thinking skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a fast paced, team-based environment

This posting is not for a specific job opening and by submitting your resume you are expressing interest in being contacted about this type of role at Apple in the future.

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We seek to promote equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.

title: Software Engineering Intern
targeted major: Khoury College of Computer Sciences
description:
We are looking for a motivated Software Engineer Intern with JAVA/Python and relational database experience with a passion for technology and solving complex problems to join our Engineering team. You will be a contributing member of our team with responsibilities for the development of both web-based applications and back-office systems. Your energy, enthusiasm, and technical curiosity, combined with your appreciation and support of our core values, will be leveraged to help us build the next generation of our wealth management applications.
 Our team of employees is made up of highly skilled software engineers, implementation specialists, business strategists, and visionaries who maintain an eye toward the future of financial technology.
Responsibilities:
Hands-on software development for applications within our VestmarkONE suite of financial services, including Portfolio Trading, Proposal Generation, and Investor Portal
Build and maintain features to match our expanding scale and performance requirements
Collaborate in a distributed environment working within an agile scrum team
Contribute to the growth and development of our core values: We Before Me, Positive Energy, Knowledge Explorer, and Own It
Required Skills:
Majoring in Computer Science or Computer Engineering 
Incoming college junior or senior (Class of 2026 or Class of 2027)
Coding Experience with JAVA, C#, Python or similar
Experience with MVC and related design patterns
Experience with SQL and Relational Databases such as SQL Server
Strong curiosity and willingness to learn in a distributed team environment
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Some experience in algorithmic and object-oriented design skills
Strong time management and written/verbal communication skills preferred
If you hold a valid EAD pursuant to OPT/STEM OPT status, please note that an internship with Vestmark does not lead to future H-1B sponsorship by our company.
 We are only considering candidates local to position location and are unable to provide relocation for this position.
This position is currently a hybrid position. However, applicants must be local to the Wakefield, MA location and available to work in the office.
Vestmark is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Vestmark prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability status, protected military or veteran status, and genetic information.  #LI-TG1 #LI-Hybrid
